SEARCH
Package com.github.timmy80.mia.core

Class Async

java.lang.Object
com.github.timmy80.mia.core.Async
public class Async extends Object
Utility class to manage calls to FunctionalInterface by an Executor with support for timeouts(See: TimeLimit).
This class offers FunctionalInterfaces for Void and NonVoid functions up to 4 arguments.

You have access to a variety of methods named with the following principles:
  • starts with run for void returning methods and call for non void methods.
  • ends with Before when the execution is time constrained and Later otherwise.
When the execution time is constrained in case of a timeout the CompletableFuture will be completed exceptionally by a TimeLimitExceededException

Examples: 

 Async.callLater(executor, testObject::methodWithTwoArg, "foo", "bar").get();
Async.runBefore(executor, TimeLimit.in(100), testObject::eventUserAction, new Date(), "click").get();
Author:
anthony

    • newTimeout

      public static io.netty.util.Timeout newTimeout(long delay, TimeUnit unit, TimerTask timerTask)
      Create a new Timeout. If the delay is reached, the timerTask is called on the thread of the timer.
      If you need your timeout to be handled on a specific thread use newTimeout(Executor, long, TimeUnit, TimerTask)
      Parameters:
      delay - the delay of this timer
      unit - the unit of the delay
      timerTask - the function called after the delay is reached
      Returns:
      a Timeout for the given args

    • newTimeout

      public static io.netty.util.Timeout newTimeout(long delayms, TimerTask timerTask)
      Create a new Timeout. If the delay is reached, the timerTask is called on the thread of the timer.
      If you need your timeout to be handled on a specific thread use newTimeout(Executor, long, TimerTask)
      Parameters:
      delayms - the delay of this timer in milliseconds
      timerTask - the function called after the delay is reached
      Returns:
      a Timeout for the given args

    • newTimeout

      public static io.netty.util.Timeout newTimeout(Executor executor, long delayms, TimerTask timerTask)
      Create a new Timeout. If the delay is reached, the timerTask is called on the given executor.
      Parameters:
      executor - the executor that will call the timeoutFunction
      delayms - the delay of this timer in milliseconds
      timerTask - the function called after the delay is reached
      Returns:
      a Timeout for the given args

    • newTimeout

      public static io.netty.util.Timeout newTimeout(Executor executor, long delay, TimeUnit unit, TimerTask timerTask)
      Create a new Timeout. If the delay is reached, the timerTask is called on the given executor.
      Parameters:
